node.title: Up-and-coming Hawthorn player tests positive to COVID-19
node.alt: A Hawthorn AFL player stands with his hands on his hips during a training session.
node.description: Finn Maginness is in quarantine, as Hawthorn confirms all its players have had at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.
node.content:
["Hawthorn has confirmed AFL player\u00a0Finn Maginness has tested positive to COVID-19.", "The club released a statement saying\u00a0Maginness attended its Waverley Park facility on Monday, but did not have any COVID-19 symptoms until Tuesday morning.", "He underwent a test and entered\u00a0isolation while awaiting the result. He will now quarantine as per the AFL and Victorian government's protocols.", "The club\u00a0said all Hawthorn players were \"either fully vaccinated or are scheduled for their second dose in the coming days\".", "\"As a club we are taking every precaution to ensure the health and wellbeing of our staff and the broader community is maintained,\" Hawks chief executive Justin Reeves said in the club statement.", "\"Appropriate wellbeing supports have been put in place to support Finn and those who are isolating as a result of this case.", "\"Every staff member and player that needs to be tested is being tested and the clear processes the club and AFL have in place has ensured that those who need to isolate are isolating.", "\"Football clubs are no different to the rest of the community, and these kinds of\u202fsituations\u202fwill continue to occur as our community continues to open up.", "\"This highlights the importance of being vaccinated and getting tested as soon as you have any symptoms.\"", "All of Maginness's close contacts have been tested and are awaiting results.", "The 20-year-old has played three AFL matches for the Hawks across two seasons.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
